alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 20 at 4:31PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...For the Yukon River, from the mouth of the Nowitna River to Nulato, including Galena, Koyukuk and Nulato. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas along the Yukon River is now occurring near the Nowitna River area. Minor flooding is possible in low lying areas along the Yukon River from the mouth of the Nowitna River to Nulato. Water could rise rapidly. Ruby is not expected to flood due to their elevation above the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A portion of the ice jam 20 miles upriver from Ruby on the Yukon River released at 7pm on Friday evening. This sent a surge of high water and ice down this section of the Yukon River, and most of the water remained within the banks of the river. At 1220 PM AKDT Saturday, The River Watch Team reports that a portion of the ice jam on the Yukon River from the mouth of the Nowitna River to the Kokrine Bible Camp remains in place. Extensive flooding formed a large lake along and upstream of where this ice jam with flooding 20 to 30 miles up the Nowitna River, and along the Yukon River from the Nowitna River upstream to Tanana. The ice jam is expected to break later this weekend. When this jam breaks another surge of high water and ice is expected to move down the Yukon between the Nowitna River and Nulato with the risk of flooding continuing through Monday. Any additional flooding that occurs is expected to be minor flooding. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River between the Nowitna and Koyukuk Rivers stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Those living in areas prone to flooding should prepare now for possible ice jam flooding. Move valuables to higher ground and prepare to evacuate on short notice. If flooding develops, water will rise very fast.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
